field_reports.description:
Incident Overview:
On the afternoon of December 21, 2023, an active shooter incident occurred at the Faculty of Philosophy building of Charles University in the center of Prague. The armed assailant entered the building and opened fire. A total of 14 individuals were fatally wounded, with the assailant being the fifteenth casualty. Additionally, 25 individuals sustained injuries, with ten suffering severe trauma. Among the deceased and injured were foreign nationals. The building was fully operational at the time, with standard academic activities in progress. Police evacuated hundreds of individuals, predominantly students.

Response by the Czech Red Cross:
The local branch of the Czech Red Cross activated its Emergency Plan in response to requests from the Emergency Services System. A team was dispatched to the site with the objective of providing support, including thermal comfort, beverages, and food, to both affected individuals and responders. Over the course of 17 hours, assistance was provided to more than 200 individuals on-site.

Simultaneously, the Czech Red Cross was involved in the operation of the official crisis hotline. Basic information about the incident and initial psychological aid were provided through this service. In the first 17 hours of operation, Czech Red Cross interveners handled 120 calls.

Additional activities: in the building where the shooting attack took place, the Czech Red Cross team quickly identified hundreds of personal belongings left behind, which the evacuees had to quickly leave. Personal luggage, clothing, valuable items were sensitively sorted, identified and tagged for subsequent handover and return.

results.name: CZE: Other - 12-2023 - Mass Shooting
